availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin Jefferson Roark (Muhlenberg County, farmer, teacher, dry goods clerk, and soldier)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer, teacher, dry goods clerk, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Roark and Martha Roark. Married to Nancy W. Davis Roark on May 6, 1858. Father of Ruric Nevel Roark. Schoolteacher in Muhlenberg County. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Dry goods clerk in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from December 9, 1861 to July 22, 1863. Served as deputy provost marshall of Greenville after his resignation.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 208A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 690.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Greenville, p. 450A.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000367208, p. 159.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 838.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 484.
Find A Grave, "CPT Martin Jefferson Roark (1833-1908)," Memorial #148516448, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/148516448# (accessed December 5, 2018).
Otto Arthur Rothert, A History of Muhlenberg County, (Louisville, KY: John P. Morton & Company), 334-335.
